(transitive, often reflexive) To turn to the advantage of.
examples: I availed myself of the opportunity.

senses.sense: (transitive) To be of service to.
examples: Artifices will not avail the sinner in the day of judgment.

senses.sense: (transitive) To promote; to assist.
(intransitive) To be of use or advantage; to answer or serve the purpose; to have strength, force, or efficacy sufficient to accomplish the object.
examples: The plea in court must avail.
This scheme will not avail.
Medicines will not avail to halt the disease.

senses.sense: (India, Africa, elsewhere proscribed) To provide; to make available; to use or take advantage of (an opportunity or available resource).
examples: You can avail discounts on food.

senses.sense: Effect in achieving a goal or aim; purpose, use (now usually in negative constructions).
examples: I tried fixing it, to no avail

senses.sense: (now only US) Proceeds; profits from business transactions.
